page.title: 13THE MALTHOUSE POTTERY.
page.content: The pottery was built in 1360, it was originally part of a grange used by the monks of Tintern Abbey. It is a rare example of an upper floor hall house.The room now used as a workshop was used for the animals.In the 18th.century it was used as a Malt house.It is run by Mr.Naylor and his son Peter.They have been there since 1972.They make domestic pottery, producing 20-30 items per day. One of the glazes they use is made from the mud of the river Wye. The pottery is only sold from the workshop.Mr.Naylor also makes items to order.Each year the pottery is visited by many people particularly parties of schoolchildren.They enjoy seeing Mr. Naylor at work and seeing the older part of the house upstairs where the original oak beams are exposed.
